form.instruction: In the lexicon, add the features makeC relative to each of the relative markers. This will assure the category C so they will occur in the complementizer position and allow their appearance only in a relative clause. Any markers which can occur as the complementizer in a CP which is a complement of a verb, like 'that' in English, need to have two separate entries in the lexicon. Mark the second entry with the feature makeC and it will default to not being allowed in relative clauses. (If the same marker can also be used in questions, a third entry is needed with the features makeC question.)

In the lexicon, add the features makeC relative to each of the relative markers. This will assure the category C so they will occur in the complementizer position and allow their appearance only in a relative clause.

In the lexicon, mark those markers which can only occur initially with the feature CP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature CP-final. Do not enter either feature on any markers which can occur on either side.
In the lexicon, add the feature relative to each of the affixes that mark relative clauses.
